alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 04 at 3:37PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...ABOVE FREEZING TEMPERATURES FOR SOUTHWEST ALASKA THIS WEEKEND THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK... A series of low pressure systems will bring warm and windy conditions to the area this weekend through Monday. Gusty southeasterly winds and pre-existing snow have combined to create areas of blowing snow along the Kuskokwim Delta coast today. Conditions are expected to improve as temperatures continue to warm this afternoon, with temperatures warming further into the 30s and 40s on Sunday and Monday. The Kuskokwim Delta and Lower Kuskokwim Valley will see the warmest conditions with highs in the lower 40s on Sunday and Monday. Bristol Bay can expect temperatures in the mid to upper 30s. These warm temperatures may result in previously sturdy ice surfaces to weaken and become less stable. Strong winds are also expected across the Kuskokwim Delta with gusts near 50 mph along coastal locations with the strongest winds expected on Sunday. The rest of the area will experience light winds. The stronger winds may cause water to rise over the ice edge along coastal locations.

area.areaDesc: Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley
